words.english: The one for whom the Vashat-offering is made
The Lord of the past, future, and present
The one with a pure Self
The supreme goal for the liberated
The one who dwells in the city (body)
The guide of those who know Yoga
The Lord of Pradhana (Prakriti) and Purusha
The one with the form of a Man-Lion
The one endowed with splendor (with Sri)
The one with beautiful hair / Slayer of the demon Kesi
The All / He who is everything
The one who manifests at will
The son of Aditi (as Vamana) / The Sun
The one with a great (Vedic) sound
The one without beginning or end
The one with a lotus in his navel
The one who makes all beings shrink (at pralaya)
The one who cannot be grasped
The one of dark complexion / The all-attractive
The support of the three regions (above, below, middle)
The one who is the golden womb/source
The one who has the earth as his womb
The consort of Ma (Lakshmi) / Descendant of Madhu
The slayer of the demon Madhu
The one who knows all actions
The one established in his own Self
The one who is the Day
The one who is the Year
He who is the boar (Dharma) and the sun
The one with an immeasurable Self
The one who is free from all attachments
The one in whom all beings dwell
The one with a benevolent mind
The one who is equal in all beings
The one accepted by the wise
The one whose actions are righteous (Dharma)
The one who is the embodiment of Dharma
The one who makes beings cry (at pralaya)
The one whose names are pure to hear
The one whose armies are everywhere
The one whose limbs are the Vedas
The one who contemplates the Vedas
The one who is both cause and effect
The one with four fangs (in Narasimha avatara)
The one born at the beginning of the universe
The one who dwells again and again (in beings)
The one who is beyond Indra
The one who holds all together
The one with a controlled Self
The one who is to be known
The one with an indefinable form
The one with an immeasurable Self
The wielder of the great bow
The one who cannot be obstructed
The protector of cows / Lord of the Earth
The one with a golden navel
The one with a lotus navel
The one who is always with devotees
The one whose Self is famous
The slayer of the enemies of the gods
The one with closed eyes (in yoga-nidra)
The one with a magnanimous intellect
The one who controls the wind
The one who turns the wheel of samsara
The one whose Self is turned away (from samsara)
The one who is the 'day' and the 'dissolver'
The one with a gracious Self
The one who honors the good
The one who rests on the waters / The goal of men
The one with an immeasurable Self
The one who has accomplished all purposes
The one whose resolves are fulfilled
The lord of the day of Dharma
The one with steps of Dharma
The one with an abdomen from which blessings flow
The one who is difficult to hold/bear
The one who pervades the rays of light
The bearer of vitality, splendor, and radiance
The one with rays like the moon
The one with the radiance of the sun
The source of the moon's nectar-like rays
The one who nourishes like the moon (spotted like a hare)
The one whose truth, law, and valor are supreme
The Lord of past, future, and present beings
The one who makes the Yugas turn
and The one of manifest form
The one dear to the wise
The one with a peacock feather crest
The creator of anger (in the wicked)
The one whose arms are the universe
The one who flows / The attacker
The supporter of the path of righteousness
The bearer of the burden (of creation)
The one who makes the winds move
The son of Vasudeva / The one who dwells in all
The one who helps cross (the ocean of samsara)
The one with a hundred turns (manifestations)
The one with eyes like a lotus
The one with a lotus navel
The one who is to be meditated upon in the heart-lotus
The one with Garuda on his flag
The one who shines in bodies (as the Self)
The knower of the right time
The one who takes the sacrificial offering
The one known through all characteristics
The red-hued one / The one who took the form of a Rohita fish
The one with a rope around his belly
The one who consumes limitlessly (at pralaya)
The one who contains Sri (splendor) within
The one who conceals / The one in the cave of the heart
The one to be led to
The one who cannot be led by another
The best among the knowers of Dharma
The one who is not perceived by the senses
The one who is the seasons
The one with a beautiful vision/discus
The one who is centered in the supreme
The one who is the recipient
The one who is the year
The most skillful and efficient in the universe
The one who is the moon
The one who remains after all is destroyed
The one who is to be worshipped
and the greatest object of worship
The one with a handsome face
The one with an auspicious sound (Vedas)
The one who has conquered anger
The one who tears apart (the unrighteous)
The one who induces sleep (through Maya)
The one who is under his own control
The one who performs many actions
The one in whom everything dwells
The one who is the basis of Dharma
The one who is not the knower (of the individual soul's suffering)
The one who has made the Sastras
The center of the planetary systems
The one who is situated in Sattva-guna
The great Lord of all beings
The lord of cattle / The lord of the earth
The sustainer of the elements of the body
The one who gives generous gifts
The one who is the moon
The one who humbles the proud
The one born in the Dasharha clan
The one who lives (as the Jiva)
The one who rests on the great ocean
The one who brings an end (Death)
The one who is full of bliss
The one whose nature is truth
The one who took three strides
The great sage, the teacher Kapila
The Lord of the three states (waking, dreaming, deep sleep)
The one with a great horn (in Matsya avatara)
The one who destroys the created world
The one with a charming army
The wielder of the discus and mace
The one who draws all together
The one who envelops (like the evening sun)
The son of Varuna (Vasistha or Agastya)
The one possessing the six opulences
The destroyer of the six opulences (at pralaya)
The one wearing a forest garland
The one with a plough as a weapon (Balarama)
The one who is the radiance in the sun
The wielder of the good bow (Sharnga)
The one with a broken axe (as Parashurama)
The one not born from a womb
The one praised by three Saman chants
The one who delights in the earth
The one who rests in the waters (on a water-lily)
The one whose eyes shower desires
The one who is fond of Dharma
The one who never turns back
The one whose Self is withdrawn (from senses)
The one with the Srivatsa mark on his chest
The best among the possessors of Sri
The shelter of the three worlds
The lord of the hosts of luminaries
The one with a conquered Self (mind)
The one whose Self is easily attainable
The one who has no doubts
The one with no lord above him
The one who rests on the earth (as an idol)
The one who is pure existence
The one with a completely pure Self
The one who is not obstructed
The slayer of the demon Kalanemi
The Self of the three worlds
The Lord of the three worlds
The slayer of the demon Keshi
The one who has all desires fulfilled
The one with an indefinable form
The one who is favorable to Brahman (Vedas, etc.)
The one who performs Brahman (tapas) and is Brahma (the creator)
The one who is in the form of a Brahmana
The one who controls all that is denoted by 'Brahma'
The one who is dear to Brahmanas
The one who is to be praised
The one with the speed of the mind
The one whose seed is gold
The one in whom all dwell
The one with a benevolent mind
The supreme goal for the good
The one with a heroic army
The one attended by the good dwellers of Yamuna
The dwelling place of all beings
The one who pervades and sports
The one whose form is the universe
The one of a hundred forms
The one of a hundred faces
The one who is affectionate to devotees
The one with a golden hue
The supporter of the three worlds
The best among the wielders of all weapons
The one who holds the reins
The ultimate goal of the four (varnas and asramas)
The knower of the four Vedas
The one-footed (pervading the universe with one quarter)
The skillful turner (of the wheel of samsara)
The one whose Self is detached
The one who is difficult to overstep
The one who is difficult to obtain
The one who is difficult to approach
The one who is difficult to house (in the mind)
The one who expands the thread
The one whose actions are like Indra's
The one who has accomplished all actions
The one with a jewel-like navel
The one who is worshipped (like the sun)
The Lord of all lords of speech
The one who delights in the earth
The one who offers jasmine-like purity
The one whose desires are immortal
The one with an immortal body
The conqueror and tormentor of enemies
The slayer of Chanura, the champion of Andhra
The one with a beautiful face
The one of the ancient lineage
The one who enhances the lineage
The one who makes ascetics strive
The one who makes things dwindle
The one who makes the wind his vehicle
The knower of the science of archery
The one who is full of Sattva-guna
The one devoted to true Dharma
The one who is the object of desire
The one whose path is through the sky
The one who shines in various ways
The one with the sun as his eye
The eater and enjoyer of sacrifices
The imperishable monkey (Sun) who drinks water
The one who is the benevolent bestower of well-being
The one who is not fierce
The one whose commands are powerful
The one who bears all sounds
The one who is not cruel
The one whose hearing and chanting are meritorious
The one who has conquered anger
The one with a profound Self
The one who assigns various duties
The one who gives various commands
The one who is the directions
The cause of birth of all beings
The one who blossoms like a flower-smile
The one who is above all
The one who walks the path of truth
The one who is the transaction (of the universe)
The one who makes beings live through Prana
The one who transcends birth, death, and old age
The tree of the three worlds (bhu, bhuva, sva)
The one who helps cross over
The one whose limbs are the sacrifice
The performer of the concluding part of a sacrifice
The digger (who dug out the earth as Varaha)
The wielder of the Sharnga bow
The one with a chariot wheel in hand
The one who has all implements as weapons
The one wearing a forest garland
The one with the Sharnga bow
The one with the Nandaka sword
